cs.IT, cs.CC, cs.SI, cs.DS, cs.LG. 

This paper deals with the analysis and construction of error-correcting codes, which is a topic that falls under the umbrella of information theory (cs.IT). The paper specifically focuses on polar codes, which are a type of code used in communication systems, and analyzes their error exponent bounds and constructions. This involves mathematical and computational techniques, which could also place the paper in the categories of computer science theory (cs.CC) and computational complexity (cs.DS). The paper also discusses the performance of polar codes on symmetric channels, which could relate to the sub-category of signal processing (cs.SI). Finally, the paper uses techniques from coding theory to construct polar codes, which could also place it in the sub-category of machine learning (cs.LG).
